Description: Sets the starting year
If a game is specified, loads that game immediately. Note: -g can load both savegames and scenarios.
Sets the random seed
Admin chat
Max number of players
Max companies 15
The value set to this parameter represents the year the server will restart
The game is automatically paused when the number of active players is less than this amount
Sets the number AI competitors in the game.
Sets the frequency of towns created on a new map.
Sets the frequency of industries for a new map.

Sets the maximum initial loan for a new game. Always in British Pounds. Changing the Currency under the [locale] section or in the Game options window will modify the maximum loan amount by the exchange rate of the chosen currency. The maximum loan amount will increase over time if Inflation is on in the [economy] section.
Sets the initial interest charged on loans for a new map.
Sets the running (maintenance) costs level for all vehicles.
If competitors are set to greater than zero then, competitor speed sets the speed at which the AI competitors will build.
Sets the frequency which vehicles break down in the game.
Sets the bonus multiplier for subsidies offered in the game.
Sets the time multiplier for subsidies offered in the game.
Sets the cost of construction in the game.
Sets the terrain type for generating a new map. 0 = very flat 1 = flat 2 = hilly  3 = mountainous 4 = alpinist
Sets the sea level, thus, the size of the area covered by seas and lakes on a new map 0 = very low 1 = low 2 = medium  3 = high 4 = custom
Sets whether economic recessions can occur on new maps.
Sets whether trains are disallowed to reverse at stations.
Sets whether disasters can occur on a new map.

Sets the city council's attitude toward area restructuring in the game. A player rated poor or worse by the council will not be allowed to place stations or demolish town roads, bridges or buildings. The less tolerant the council is set to be, the faster their rating will fall due to the demolition of town assets (including trees on otherwise open land). The council's rating will improve over time by effectively moving freight, mail and people to and from stations in the town's area of control. 0 = permissive 1 = tolerant 2 = hostile

Select how towns should build their roads. You can choose between the default algorithm (0), an improved algorithm (1), a 2x2 grid (2), a 3x3 grid (3) or random (4). The random setting picks one of the four option randomly for each town.
Towns are allowed to build roads
Allows you to found a town during the game. You can configure whether to use the road layout used by other towns in the game, or to choose the road layout yourself.

With this activated, the number of airports which can be placed in the vicinity of a town is not fixed anymore. Instead it depends upon the noise level of the Airports, their distance to the town centre and the town's attitude.
Inflation, as in the real world, causes prices to go up as time passes. There is a patch for turning this feature off.
This setting allows you to build two or more industries of the same type on land that comes under the jurisdiction of one town.
A setting that allows you to bribe local authorities.
Allows you to Fund buildings during the game.
Allows you to Fund roads during the game
Allows you to Give money to other players
Allows you to buy shares of other companies (or the whole other company, if it is AI controlled).
Minimal year to have passed in game befor you can buy shares of other companies
Select how fast towns should grow. You can also disable town growth.
Amount of towns that will grow to city size. 0 disables.
Remove absurd road-elements during the road construction

Controls whether infrastructure costs money to maintain. If maintenance of infrastructure is on, an amount, calculated from the number of tiles with rails, canals or locks, will be paid at regular intervals.
If vehicle breakdowns are switched off, vehicles will not go to depots or hangars for servicing.

In case you have several vehicles (trains, trucks etc.) waiting for one type of cargo on a station it is much more effective to force loading an arrived vehicle and only after it is full and ready to go start loading next. Note that this is all the patch does; it has no FIFO attributes, and does not depend on which vehicle came first.
Airports never expire

With this setting enabled, the catchment area around a 'station' varies depending on what type of station it is. For example, train stations have a larger catchment area than bus stations and airports' catchment areas are bigger still. It even varies with the type of airport; Intercontinental Airports have the biggest.
It means that players can join stations that are separated from each other by a number of tiles as set in the station spread limit.
Vehicle road side
Set the default or a more realistic acceleration calculation for trains. With this setting set to realistic, trains will travel faster up hill, but slower through tight corners.

Set the default or a more realistic acceleration calculation for road vehicles. With this setting set to realistic. The power and tractive effort settings for vehicles only become meaningful with realistic acceleration, they will travel faster up hill, but slower through corners.
Sets the steepness of slopes, trains will slow down more on slopes if this setting is set to a higher value. It only applies if the Realistic acceleration is selected.
Sets the steepness of slopes, road vehicles will slow down more on slopes if this setting is set to a higher value. It only applies if the realistic acceleration is selected.
Specifies the maximal allowed length of a train in tiles.
This setting will stop vehicles from going out of date and so they will remain available until the very end of the game.
This patch allows you to increase or decrease the maximum amount of trains per player in the game at any one time
This patch allows you to increase or decrease the maximum amount of roadvehicals per player in the game at any one time
This patch allows you to increase or decrease the maximum amount of aircraft in the game, per player, at any one time
This patch allows you to increase or decrease the maximum amount of ships in the game, per player, at any one time.
Sets whether speed limits should apply for wagons that set them. The default wagons in the game do not specify a maximum speed,
Disable electical rails
The weight of freight trains is multiplied by the multiplier set here to simulate very heavy trains for more realism
Set the speed of aircraft in relation to rail, road and water vehicles. In plain TTD,
When enabled, this feature allows multiple NewGRF vehicle sets to exist side-by-side.
Set the probability of plane crashes 0 = none 1 = reduced 2 = normal
Extends every vehicles life by x years. Takes values between 0 and 100.
When this switch is on the service intervals are considered to be in percents of the max. reliability rather than days.
The default service interval when a new train is built.
The default service interval when a new road vehicle is built.
The default service interval when a new ships is built.
The default service interval when a new aircraft is built.
interval for autosave
Sets the game currency
enable Autosave on exit
Name of the server user ingame
Server name
Server password
Admin password
sets Town name Language
Valid options: [ temperate | arctic | tropic | toyland ]
Sets max map height
This setting allows you to determine at what altitude snow will appear.
Year the game will end
This specifies the land generation system that you use, either the Original or Terra Genesis Perlin (TGP).
This option determines the maximum allowed distance (in tiles) from the edge of the map for an Oil Refinery.
Sets the smoothness 0 = very smooth 1 = smooth 2 = rough 3 = very rough.
This sets the variety of distribution. 0 = none 1 = very low 2 = low 3 = medium 4 = high 5 = very high
0 = none tree placing 1 = original 2 = improved tree placing
The Map size determines the size and shape of your map. max 12
The Map size determines the size and shape of your map. max 12
Bitset of the borders that are water by creating an new game
Specifies the exact number of towns on a new map
Specifies roughly the percentage of the area covered by seas and lakes on a new map,
sets minimum river length
Sets total amount of rivers
